intro: Hybanthera villosa, commonly known as the hairy hybanthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hybanthera villosa is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
